io.libraft.algorithm
Interface Log

public interface Log

LogEntry storage service.

Stores a sequence of LogEntry instances indexed by a long >= 0 referred to as a "log index". Any two consecutive LogEntry instances satisfy the log property LP1: logIndex(LogEntry0) + 1 = logIndex(LogEntry1). Implementations need only guarantee that each individual operation is atomic. They must wrap all implementation-specific checked exceptions in a StorageException and rethrow them.

          Get the LogEntry at index.

          Remove all LogEntry instances at log indices >= index, where index >=0.

last LogEntry in the log if the log contains any entries or null otherwise

put

void put(LogEntry logEntry)
         throws StorageException
Put the LogEntry at the index specified by LogEntry.getIndex().

logEntry may overwrite another instance previously at that index. The implementation does not have to prevent this. It also does not have to verify that LP1 is maintained.

Parameters:
logEntry - instance of LogEntry to insert at LogEntry.getIndex()
Throws:
StorageException

truncate

void truncate(long index)
              throws StorageException
Remove all LogEntry instances at log indices >= index, where index >=0. This operation is a noop if index is beyond the end of the log. At the end of this operation the log contains only entries 0...(index - 1).

Parameters:
index - index >=0 from which to remove LogEntry instances
Throws:
StorageException
